It is pronounced Havaya rather than its true pronunciation on account of its sanctity and in order to avoid unwittingly violating the Torah prohibition against uttering the name of God. It is often written in this form in order to avoid the prohibition against erasing the name of God.  This name of God represents the main [levels](/topics/level) of existence. Its four letters correspond to four of the five primary [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot): the *yod¬* parallels [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1); the first *heh*, [*Bina*](/topics/bina3)>; the *vav*, [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1); and the final *heh*, [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1)), while the upper point of the *yod* corresponds to the fifth, [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), the root of all the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot). The letters of the name also parallel the four worlds, [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut) ([Emanation](/topics/atzilut)), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1) ([Creation](/topics/beria1)), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1) ([Formation](/topics/yetzira1)), and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2) ([Action](/topics/asiya2)), while the upper point of the *yod* parallels the world of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2).  Just as each of the letters of the name corresponds to a different [level](/topics/level) of reality, so too the various ways of writing the name express different [levels](/topics/level) in the upper worlds. Thus, for example, the name [*Ab*](/topics/ab) is the one that is revealed in the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) in every [level](/topics/level) of reality. At the same time, every [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) has a specific name (“*Havaya*”) that is revealed through it, e. g., the name that is revealed in the second [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2) is “*Havaya* of *Ab* of *Adam Kadmon*,” and it refers to that [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1).

The *yod* of *Havaya* is the first expansion of the [light](/topics/light2), which is called the first level (see v. 1, Answers, answer 69). The first *heh* of *Havaya* is the first prevailment in the [light](/topics/light2), called the second level. The *vav* of *Havaya* is the second expansion of the [light](/topics/light2), which is called the third level. Finally, the last *heh* of *Havaya* is the second prevailment in the [light](/topics/light2), called the fourth level (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 1, Q & A 70).

*Ḥaya* is the name of the fourth of the five [levels](/topics/level) of the soul: [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh), [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1), [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2), [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1), and [*yeḥida*](/topics/yehida1). These five [levels](/topics/level) of the soul correspond to the five primary *sefirot*: [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). They also correspond to the five worlds: [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2), [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1), and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2). The concept of the five [levels](/topics/level) of the soul relates to five qualities of supernal light which illuminate people as well as the [levels](/topics/level) of broader reality. The *ḥaya* is the light that corresponds to the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) and the world of [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), and it illuminates the body of a person or a [level](/topics/level) only after the illumination of the three lower [levels](/topics/level) of the soul, which are [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh), [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1), and [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2).
The light of [Ḥokhma](/topics/hokhma1), in the mystical meaning of the verse (Ecclesiastes 7:12): “Wisdom [*ḥokhma*] preserves the life of he who has it” (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 27).

The head refers to the highest part of a [level](/topics/level). For example, in each [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1), the first three [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are considered the head of that [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1). Additionally, the root of every [level](/topics/level) may also be defined as its head. This might occur when the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) resulting from a [*fusion through collision*](/topics/fusion-through-collision) with a [partition](/topics/partition2) [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) the supernal light. While this process ultimately allows for the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) to serve as a complete vessel for the supernal light, initially it only serves as the conceptual root of that actualized vessel. This initial stage of [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) of the supernal light by the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) is called the head of the particular [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1).

The [first three](/topics/first-three1) [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are the lights that came before the vessels, which are [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) in the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) that ascends to them from the [partition](/topics/partition2) that is located from them and above. That is, the first three [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) – [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) – which are also known as the head of the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 13).
Those first three and the head are the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of [direct light](/topics/direct-light1), which are [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) in the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) that ascends from the [partition](/topics/partition2) and above, meaning the beginning and root. For they are not yet considered complete vessels that are suited to the full [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) of the [light](/topics/light2), but only as roots (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 3, Q & A 96).
In addition, the [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) of the lights in the vessels must initially be in “potential” form, and only subsequently “actualized.” The [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) of the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) in “potential” form is called head, while the [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) of the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) in “actualized” form is called [body](/topics/body3) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 4, Q & A 13).

The [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of *Ḥesed* is the fourth of the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot). When the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are divided into the five primary [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) – [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) – *Ḥesed* is encompassed in the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) as the [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) [level](/topics/level) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) (see [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1)). The term *sefirat* *Ḥesed* is also a reference to different [levels](/topics/level) and *sefirot* in lower structures of reality that are all derivatives of the root *sefira* of *Ḥesed* found in the [*direct light*](/topics/direct-light1). This [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) is called *Ḥesed* because it contains the light of giving (*ḥassadim*) that emanates from the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), which precedes *Ḥesed*, the light that is the essence of giving and bestowal on the part of a created being and that did not undergo any constriction. In the structure of [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf), which is analogous to the human body, *Ḥesed* is always presented as the right hand of the *partzuf*, the hand that represents bestowal and closeness.

The [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of *Hod* is the eighth of the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot). When the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are divided into the five primary [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) – [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) – *Hod* is encompassed in the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) as the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) [level](/topics/level) for the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1).  *Hod* is the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) which completes the left line or column in every [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) or world. Its essence is that of the fourth [level](/topics/level) ([*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1)). Because of this, and its role of completion, the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of *Hod* is considered female, and possessing the attribute of judgment. The name *Hod* derives from the word *hoda’ah*, thanksgiving, because the feminine (the left side) is grateful for the light that the masculine (the right side) shines on it. This light is the light of giving, which carries the light of wisdom with it, light, which was restricted as a result of the first [constriction](/topics/constriction). In the structure of the [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf), which correlates with the human body, the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of *Hod* is associated with the left thigh or leg.

The second of the *sefirot*, following *Keter*, this *sefira* is characterized by the essence of giving and bestowal from the Creator to the created beings – or, in other words, the first [level](/topics/level) or phase of the supernal light, or direct light, that emanates from the essence of the Creator, which is characterized by the will to give and is also called the “light of wisdom” (each of the five main [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are often described as [levels](/topics/level), with [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) serving as the “root” [level](/topics/level) (the zero point) and the next four [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) representing [levels](/topics/level) one through four). It is called *Ḥokhma*, or Wisdom, because it emanates all the wisdoms in existence. Additionally, it represents the concept of the unbounded mind and intellect, undefined and unrestricted, of the as yet undefined first flash of awareness.  This *sefira* is present at the [head](/topics/head2) of every [level](/topics/level) and [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1). Each of the five primary *sefirot* is parallel to one of the five worlds that form existence. The parallel world to this *sefira* is the world of [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut) which is united with the Creator and has no limitations or boundaries. Each of the five primary *sefirot* is also parallel to one of the five [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf). The [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) that is parallel to this [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) is called *Abba*, or “Father.”  Certain lower [levels](/topics/level) of existence are also referred to as the *sefira* of *Ḥokhma*. This is because they all share a basic characteristic: They are all derivatives of the first [level](/topics/level) of the supernal light, or the light of wisdom.

The [light](/topics/light2) initially spreads and emerges from the Creator as [light of *Ḥokhma*](/topics/light-of-hokhma), which is the entirety of its life force belonging to that emanated being. It incorporates the first [level](/topics/level) of the [will to receive](/topics/will-to-receive) and is called the first expansion, or the first [level](/topics/level) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 1, Q & A 69). This first [level](/topics/level) is called *Ḥokhma*, while the [light](/topics/light2) it contains is called [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1).

This refers to the female component that became part of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) of [*Arikh Anpin*](/topics/arikh-anpin1) during the [second constriction](/topics/second-constriction). Each of the [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf) of [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut) received a female component and the female component of the first three [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) is called *Ima Ila'ah*, the "supernal mother."

When a [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) is in a state of gestation or infancy, it is described as being in the phase of immaturity (*katnut*). In this phase, the influence of the [second constriction](/topics/second-constriction) causes the [levels](/topics/level) and [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf) below the constriction to be split, ejecting some of the vessels to the [level](/topics/level) below. In this state, the higher lights ([brains](/topics/brains2)) of a given [level](/topics/level) are not present. As a result, the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) is described as having no spiritual [head](/topics/head2)since some of the needed vessels for containing the higher lights have been ejected to the [level](/topics/level) below. This lack of [brains](/topics/brains2) is termed “immaturity,” corresponding to the immature state of a child that lacks understanding (brain development).

The two *partzufin* of suckling [gestation](/topics/gestation) in each [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) are called immaturity, because of the lack of the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of the [brains](/topics/brains2), which is the [head](/topics/head2) of every [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 15, Q & A 119).

The inner light refers to the supernal light that successfully permeates and is [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) within every [level](/topics/level) of reality, in accordance with the [level](/topics/level)’s capacity to contain it at any given time. This contrasts with [surrounding light](/topics/surrounding-light), the light that reality cannot contain because it is too limited to contain the infinite divine light and so the surrounding light cannot shine within reality at present (but will do so in the future).
The [light](/topics/light2) [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) in a [vessel](/topics/vessel1) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 5).

Hardness, or *kashyut*, is the capacity of the [partition](/topics/partition2) to rebuff the supernal light and return it to its source. This is similar to what occurs in the material world: A soft surface absorbs the kinetic energy of objects that are dragged over it, whereas a hard surface will rebuff them. The measure of a [partition](/topics/partition2)’s hardness is commensurate with its measure of [opacity](/topics/opacity) (*oviyut*), or the will it contains to receive the supernal light. The greater the measure of the will to receive the supernal light, the greater measure supernal light will be drawn to the created being, and greater the force of the rejection of the light.

*Kelippot* are [levels](/topics/level) of reality that do not contain any will to give, only the will to receive. Since their essence is one of receiving or “taking,” they are constantly trying to pull all of reality into themselves – in essence, to swallow everything in existence. Since the essence of life is the divine light, which is composed entirely of the energy of giving, they and all that is connected to them are considered to be “dead.” The *kelippot* are therefore compared to the husks or shells of a fruit, which are detached from the life that is inside the fruit. Since these entities are wholly receiving, unable to give, they have no true connection with the life force of creation, like the dead.

See section 83, where it is explained that spiritual beings are separated and divided from one another by their difference of form. Know that divergent forms, from one extreme to the other, separates these beings and distances them from one extreme to its opposite, until there is no suckling between them at all. As you already know, the supernal light contains only a will to give, not to receive anything, whereas the kelippot have the exact opposite forms: Only a will to receive and to swallow everything; they have no will to give whatsoever. Therefore, they are separated from the Source of Life and are called dead, they and all that cleave to them. This must be understood (Talmud Eser Sefirot, v. 3, Q & A 88).

The resting of a root on a level is called [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), in the sense of *makhtir*, meaning surrounding, since it is the purest of the level, and thus it surrounds the entire [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) from above (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 35).

*Keter* is the name of the first and highest [sefira](/topics/sefira2) of the ten [sefirot](/topics/sefirot). However, *Keter* is not always counted as one of the ten [sefirot](/topics/sefirot). Just as a crown, a *keter*, on a person’s head encompasses him but is not part of his body, so too the [sefira](/topics/sefira2) of *Keter*, due to its lofty status, can be considered above the ten [sefirot](/topics/sefirot). When *Keter* is regarded as part of the system, it is the highest part of the [head](/topics/head2), which is comprised of the first three [levels](/topics/level): *Keter*, [Ḥokhma](/topics/hokhma1), and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3). When *Keter* is not included in the list of [sefirot](/topics/sefirot), it is substituted by *Da’at*, a structure that can be considered a pseudo-*sefira*.
The seven lower [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot), at the time of the shattering of the vessels, are called [Kings](/topics/place).

It is known that [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) is constructed entirely from the [brains](/topics/brains2) of *Imma*. *Imma*, which is [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), divides into the [first three](/topics/first-three1) and the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones). Her [first three](/topics/first-three1) are [*Abba* and *Imma Ila’in*](/topics/abba-and-imma-ilain), which are [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim) that are covered and rebuffed from [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), while her [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) are [*Yisrael* *Sabba* and *Tevuna*](/topics/yisrael-sabba-and-tevuna1) and revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim) in the illumination of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1). Likewise, [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) that is constructed from *Imma* is in the mystical meaning of the verse: “And I am a smooth man” (Genesis 27:11). For from the [chest](/topics/chest) and above, the [first three](/topics/first-three1) of *Imma* illuminate in it, that is, the covered [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim), whereas from the [chest](/topics/chest) and below, the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) illuminate in it, which are revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). Since they are two virtually opposite expressions, the verse calls it “a smooth man,” smooth of hairs, as is known. 
Now, for the same reason the [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba) of [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) also divides into two. There is an upper [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba), from the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the [first three](/topics/first-three1) of *Imma*, which is covered [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). This is called Leah. She [enclothes](/topics/enclothe) on its [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), and [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), until the [chest](/topics/chest), which is in the place of her covered [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). It also has a second [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba), from the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) of *Imma*, which is revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim), called [Rachel](/topics/rachel5). She [enclothes](/topics/enclothe) in the place of its [chest](/topics/chest) and below, that is, in the place of its revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). Accordingly, Leah receives only the [back side](/topics/back-side) of the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) ([Foundation](/topics/yesod1)) of *Imma*, which ends at the place of the [chest](/topics/chest). For she rebuffs [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) like the [first three](/topics/first-three1) of *Imma*, and cannot venture from the [chest](/topics/chest) and below, where the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Abba*](/topics/abba1) serves openly. The reverse is true of [Rachel](/topics/rachel5): Her entire holding is only in the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Abba*](/topics/abba1), in the mystical meaning of “father (*Abba*) founded (*yasad*) the daughter.” Consequently, she cannot suckle from above the [chest](/topics/chest) of [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1), since there the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Abba*](/topics/abba1) is hidden and concealed in the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of *Imma* (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 14, Q & A 125).

The letters are the > in which the essences are [enclothed](/topics/enclothe). They comprise twenty-two chief levels, from which all the [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf) are constructed, and these are called the twenty-two letters (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 6, Q & A 10).

The word “level” has multiple meanings and usages in the writings of the Sulam, though these different meanings share a common core. The main idea is a reference to a layering structure in existence. At the “top” of the layers is the Source of all existence, the endless supernal light of the [*Ein Sof*](/topics/ein-sof1), the Endless One. This light shines “downward” through a series of layers, barriers or filters, ultimately manifesting in the form of the world we experience. It is these layers that give rise to the diversity and multiplicity we perceive in the created world around us, as the light “appears” differently after each layer it traverses.  There are many different kinds of layers in this system, and these form the different levels referred to in the text. Generally, there are five main structures of levels, which are the worlds of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2), [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1) and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2). However, within each of these categories are also many levels or layers. Additionally, the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot), the main ingredients of all creation, are often described as “levels,” because they form the structures of the various layers of creation. Similarly, the more complex constructs of the [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf) are referred to as levels as well.  In addition to these layered levels, the Sulam describes how each aspect and level within existence contains all other aspects and levels. For example, each of the five main [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are described as levels, and also as individually containing all five of the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot). Each of the five [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) comprising one [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) are said to be five levels within that individual [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2). This structure is somewhat similar to that of fractal geometry, in which macrostructures are mirrored by microstructures, and large structures are formed of smaller, parallel structures.  Thus, when the word “level” appears, it is important to be attentive to the discussion in the text, and to realize the word is used with some liberality, as opposed to one fixed type of usage. Fundamentally, it always refers to the layered structure of reality in some way, though there is variance in its application in each context.

The light of giving (*or ḥassadim*) is the type of [*shefa*](/topics/shefa1)  that is revealed as a result of the will or desire of a created being to give. This light originates in the second [level](/topics/level) of the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot), the [level](/topics/level) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3). This is in contrast to the other type of [*shefa*](/topics/shefa1), the light of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), which is the light of the Creator that emanates in and from the first [level](/topics/level) of the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot), the [level](/topics/level) of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1). Although the light of giving is not the main lifeforce of the created beings, it contains an important quality related to the [constriction](/topics/constriction) (*tzimtzum*). Constriction involves the abstention of the vessel of the will to receive (the vessel of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1)) from receiving the light of the Creator. However, this [constriction](/topics/constriction) of the vessel applies only to the light of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1). The receiving vessel for the light of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) is the will of the created being to receive. After the [constriction](/topics/constriction) this vessel is disqualified as a vessel for the divine light. However, [constriction](/topics/constriction) does not apply to the light of giving, whose vessel is the will of the created being to give. One result of this difference in the effects of the [constriction](/topics/constriction) is that the light of giving illuminates in places and ways where the light of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) does not shine. Additionally, by [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) the light of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) in the light of giving, the light of giving helps the light of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) illuminate [levels](/topics/level) from which it would otherwise be restricted.
The [light](/topics/light2) drawn to an emanated being in the first expansion, which is the entirety of the life force and essence of the emanated being (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 1, Q & A 5).

The [will to receive](/topics/will-to-receive) in an emanated being is called a [vessel](/topics/vessel1), while the [*shefa*](/topics/shefa1) it receives is called light (*Talmud Eser HaSefirot*, v. 1, Q & A 2).

The ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of the straight vessels are called a channel from the perspective of their vessels, while from the perspective of the [light](/topics/light2) inside them they are called line. Only the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of the world of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2) are called one line, whereas ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) in the world of [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut) ([Emanation](/topics/atzilut)) have three >>lines>> (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 60).

Before the ascent of the bottom *heh* in the [eyes](/topics/eyes4), the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) were separated from one another, one above the other, in ascending order of purity. As is known, spiritual beings are differentiated by a change of form, which is how they form separated entities. However, after the bottom *heh* has ascended in the [eyes](/topics/eyes4), and the [opacity](/topics/opacity) ([*ovyut*](/topics/ovyut)) of the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) has been incorporated in every [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) up to [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) and has become the left [line](/topics/line1) in all ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) together (in contrast to the essence of the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) that became the right [line](/topics/line1), as is known), such that the middle [line](/topics/line1) subsequently descends through the [fusion](/topics/fusion-through-collision) of the supernal light, and balances between them, the result is that all ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) have been connected and rectified in a single [fusion](/topics/fusion-through-collision) by means of the middle [line](/topics/line1), in the mystical meaning of the private domain. In this manner, all [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) are connected and rectified in each other, like one level. This is called the rectification of three lines (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 10, Q & A 56).

A name for [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), after the last *heh* of the name [*Havaya*](/topics/havaya2). Furthermore, when the [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba) of [*Ze*’*er* *Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) is together with it back-to-back and they are attached to a single wall, it is called the bottom *heh* of [*Havaya*](/topics/havaya2), for it is attached to the *vav* of [*Havaya*](/topics/havaya2) in its name. Subsequently, at the time of [maturity](/topics/maturity2), after it has been sawn away from it and has become a separate [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) in its own right, it has a special name of its own, *Adonai* or *Elohim* (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 9, Q & A 36).

children.en: Mah and Ban of Adam Kadmon (Kabbalah)

description.en:
*Mah* (or *mem-heh*) of *Adam Kadmon* is the name of the fourth [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of the world of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2). This [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) is born from the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of *Sag* of *Adam Kadmon* and is the embodiment of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) or [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) in the world of *Adam Kadmon*.
The name *Mah* stems from the Tetragrammaton, the four-letter name of God, as follows: In each [level](/topics/level) of reality, the name of God, also referred to as the name of *Havaya*, is revealed in a unique manner to that [level](/topics/level). This is expressed through the numerical value of the letters of the name, when it is written out in full – that is, when each letter of the name is spelled out as a word on its own. The numerical value of the name of *Havaya* that is unique to the [level](/topics/level) of [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) is *mem-heh*, or 45. This number results when the letters of the name are written as follows: *Yod* (*yod-vav-dalet*), *heh* (*heh-alef*), *vav* (*vav-alef-vav*), *heh* (*heh-alef*) (*yod*=10; *vav*=6; *dalet*=4; *heh*=5; *alef*=1). 

*Ban* (or *bet-nun*) of *Adam Kadmon* is the name of the fourth [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of the world of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2)This [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) is born from the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of *Mah* of *Adam Kadmon* and embodies [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) in the world of *Adam Kadmon*.
The name *Ban* stems from the Tetragrammaton, the four-letter name of God, as follows: In each [level](/topics/level) of reality, the name of God, also referred to as the name of *Havaya*, is revealed in a unique manner to that [level](/topics/level). This is expressed through the numerical value of the letters of the name when it is written out in full – that is, when each letter is spelled out as a word on its own. The numerical value of the name of *Havaya* that is unique to the [level](/topics/level) of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) is *bet-nun*, or 52, when it is written as follows: *Yod* (*yod-vav-dalet*), *heh* (*heh-heh*), *vav* (*vav-vav*), *heh* (*heh-heh*) (*yod*=10; *vav*=6; *dalet*=4; *heh*=5).

*Mah,* or *mem-heh*, is the numerical value of 45 in Hebrew letters (*mem*=40; *heh*=5). This numerical value is derived from the letters of the Tetragrammaton, the four-letter name of God referred to as the name of [Havaya](/topics/havaya2), when they are spelled out in full using the letter *alef*. In other words, each of the letters of the name of [Havaya](/topics/havaya2) is written out as a separate word, and the letter *alef* is used to fill out the letters, as follows: The *yod* is spelled out as *yod-vav-dalet* (יוד), the *heh* is spelled *heh-alef* (הא), the *vav* is spelled *vav-alef-vav* (ואו), and the final *heh* is spelled *heh-alef* (הא). *Mah* represents the [level](/topics/level) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) or the light of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1).

*Malkhut* is the last of the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot). The essence of this [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) is its capacity as the ultimate vessel, the endless will to receive, which draws and reveals the infinite supernal light. This vessel actualizes the purpose of creation, which is for Ein Sof to bestow good on creation. Although this is its essence, the [*constriction](/topics/constriction) ([tzimtzum](/topics/tzimtzum1))* prevents *Malkhut* from receiving the supernal light, protecting *Malkhut* from becoming subsumed by the supernal light. The constriction adds a new element to *Malkhut*: In addition to expressing the concept of receiving, it also possesses the attribute of constriction and judgment.  The [partition](/topics/partition2) that rests upon *Malkhut*, a result of the [constriction](/topics/constriction) ([*tzimtzum*](/topics/tzimtzum1)), repels the supernal light, which gives rise to the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1). This leads to the creation of new vessels, which give rise to the manifestation of the creation. *Malkhut* is positioned at the bottom end of each [level](/topics/level) of existence, but also begins the manifestation of the next [level](/topics/level) below.  *Malkhut* is associated with the female aspect of creation, as well as the mouth. These symbols represent the capacity of *Malkhut* to receive the lights of the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) above and to transmit them to the [levels](/topics/level) below. It corresponds to the [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba), or “female,” [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) persona.

The phase of maturity (*gadlut*) refers to when the [second constriction](/topics/second-constriction) is reduced, allowing the vessels ejected in the state of immaturity to return to their original [level](/topics/level). This change allows the higher lights ([brains](/topics/brains2)) to return to the given [level](/topics/level) as well, since they now have vessels to receive them. As a result, the [level](/topics/level) is said to be “mature,” since it has now acquired a more developed state of [brains](/topics/brains2). There are multiple degrees of maturity, corresponding to different permutations of the lights and different orientations of the vessels to each other when receiving those lights.
The [brains](/topics/brains2) of [*Abba*](/topics/abba1), that is, the illumination of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), are called maturity (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 7, Q & A 31).

The mouth, as the lowest organ in the human head, represents the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), the last and lowest of the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot). With respect to the structure of the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1), which corresponds to the entire structure of man, the mouth is the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the ten *sefirot* of the [head](/topics/head2).
The [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the [head](/topics/head2) is called mouth (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 3, Q & A 80).

The [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) ([Kingship](/topics/malkhut1)) of the [body](/topics/body3), from where the limitation and rejection of the [light](/topics/light2) begins in practice, is called navel (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 4, Q & A 31).

This is the name for the first and lowest of the five [levels](/topics/level) (and corresponding lights) of the soul, *nefesh*, [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1), [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2), [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1), and [*yeḥida*](/topics/yehida1). These five [levels](/topics/level) of the soul correspond to the five primary *sefirot*, of [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), as well as the five worlds, [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2), [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1), and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2). The concept of the five [levels](/topics/level) of the soul relates to five qualities of supernal light which illuminate people as well as the [levels](/topics/level) of broader reality. The *nefesh* corresponds to and is the light that belongs to the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) and the world of [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2), and it is the first aspect of the soul that is illuminated within a person or an aspect of reality.

The term *neshama* commonly refers to the soul, the divine aspect that exists within every being and sustains it. But according to the teachings of the Kabbala, the soul actually contains five [levels](/topics/level) or lights – [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh), [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1), [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2), [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1), and [*yeḥida*](/topics/yehida1) – the third of which is called “*neshama*.” These five [levels](/topics/level) (synonymous with the five lights that correspond and fill the five [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) vessels) of the soul correspond to the five [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), as well as the five worlds of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2), [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1), and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2).The *neshama* [level](/topics/level) corresponds to the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) and the world of [*Beria*](/topics/beria1), and represents the light that illuminates this [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) and world. Therefore one merits it – i.e., it illuminates in the body of a person or a [level](/topics/level) – only after meriting the lower lights (soul [levels](/topics/level)), which are [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh) and [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1). After attaining it, one can merit the higher lights of [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1) and [*yeḥida*](/topics/yehida1).

The [light](/topics/light2) that is [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) in the [vessel](/topics/vessel1) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) is called “*neshama*,” in the sense of *neshima*, a breath, since *neshama* is mainly a source for [*Ze*’*er* *Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1), which is an expression of light and spirit. It breathes in its life force from there, in a manner of ascent and descent, in the mystical meaning of the verse: “And the living creatures ran and returned” (Ezekiel 1:14), and as in the verse: “And He breathed into his nostrils the breath of life” (Genesis 2:7). This must be understood (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 49).

The [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of *Netzaḥ* is the seventh of the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot). When the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are divided into the five primary [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) – *Keter*, *Ḥokhma*, *Bina*, *Tiferet*, and *Malkhut* – *Netzaḥ* is encompassed in the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) as the [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) [level](/topics/level) for the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) (see [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1)).  *Netzaḥ* is the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) that completes a structure called the right-hand column in every [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) or world. It is the fourth (thus, the [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) [level](/topics/level)) [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) [level](/topics/level) within the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) (see [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1)). Its essence is therefore that of the [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) [level](/topics/level) which is revealed in the lower part of every *sefira*. As a result, it is considered a “male” [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2), that is, a giving and bestowing [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2), like *Tiferet*. The name *Netzaḥ* comes from the word for victory, *nitzaḥon*. *Netzaḥ* conquers impurity, meaning that, although it is in contact with lower aspects of existence, it simultaneously has the quality of bestowal and giving. This illustrates that *Netzaḥ* is not only undamaged by its involvement in lower realities, but it actually thrives and dominates. In the structure of [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf), which is analogous to the human body, *Netzaḥ* is generally presented as the right leg of the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1).

This refers to the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) structure corresponding to the [level](/topics/level) of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). The *Nukba* is the female counterpart to the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) and most of the time it receives its lights ([brains](/topics/brains2)) through [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1). In the case of the *Nukba* of [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), receiving these [brains](/topics/brains2) allows the *Nukba* to bestow those lights upon the worlds below.

The [maturity](/topics/maturity2) of the [will to receive](/topics/will-to-receive) with a great yearning is called a great opacity ([*ovyut*](/topics/ovyut)), whereas a slight yearning is called a slight opacity ([*ovyut*](/topics/ovyut)). It is the expression of a [vessel](/topics/vessel1) drawing the [*shefa*](/topics/shefa1) in each [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1), and is accordingly called the interiority of the [vessel](/topics/vessel1) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 53).

Ovyut denotes thickness, materiality, or darkness, as opposed to purity, clarity, and spirituality. In kabbalistic terminology, it expresses the quality of the vessel, which is the will to receive. It is considered thick and dark because it is the antithesis of the eternal divine light, the essence of which is entirely giving. A greater will to receive is regarded as having greater opacity, while a vessel that contains a lesser will to receive is regarded as being more pure. This is because the greater the will to receive that a vessel acquires, the more it is distanced from the Creator and His light and the more material and dark it becomes.

[Fusion through collision](/topics/fusion-through-collision)
This refers to the activity of the [partition](/topics/partition2), which blocks and conceals the [light](/topics/light2) from the first level, and rebuffs the [light](/topics/light2) that belongs to it back to its root. This action is [fusion through collision](/topics/fusion-through-collision), a name that conveys that the action includes two opposite movements: On the one hand, it “strikes” the [light](/topics/light2), meaning it rebuffs and prevents it from illuminating. On the other hand, it “fuses” with the [light](/topics/light2), that is, it causes it to increase and spread greatly (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 23).
The giving of [light](/topics/light2) from one [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) to another is called pairing or fusion.

Panim Masbirot is a wide-ranging commentary by the Ba’al HaSulam on the writings of the Arizal, Rabbi Yitzḥak Luria Ashkenazi. Panim Masbirot is an expansive, in-depth work, accompanied by a shorter commentary called Panim Me’irot. Panim Masbirot was published between 1927 and 1930.

The partition is a barrier that prevents the supernal light from radiating into lower [levels](/topics/level) of existence. As a result, the partition rebuffs it, like a mirror that reflects light back to its source. The partition is manifest during the process of creation, as a result of the first [constriction](/topics/constriction) ([*tzimtzum*](/topics/tzimtzum1)), and it is a way of describing the resistance of the created being to receiving the supernal light in its fourth [level](/topics/level), which corresponds to, and is called, [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). The collision between the supernal light and the partition causes the light to be rebuffed, and as a result, the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) becomes a new vessel for the supernal light. There are partitions at every [level](/topics/level) of reality, and each partition has different degrees of [opacity](/topics/opacity) ([*ovyut*](/topics/ovyut)) and [hardness](/topics/kashyut) ([*kashyut*](/topics/kashyut)), giving rise to a variance in the structures of [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) that a given partition generates. This also underlies the variance found in the different [levels](/topics/level) of reality, such as the [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf). In addition to the partitions that rebuff the light, there are partitions that serve as a terminating point of a particular [level](/topics/level) of existence (such as a [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1)), and the division between one [level](/topics/level) of existence and another. In general terms, it can be said that the different operations of these differences in the partitions are the causes of the differences between the various [levels](/topics/level) and stages of creation, as a result of the variance of [opacity](/topics/opacity) and [hardness](/topics/kashyut) and the resulting varying heights of [returning light](/topics/returning-light1).

The power of [constriction](/topics/constriction) ([*tzimtzum*](/topics/tzimtzum1)) and judgment instituted in [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), which rebuffs the supernal light from [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) inside it (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 3, Q & A 63).

A *partzuf* is a configuration of the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) into more complex structures that serve to reveal the divine light that emanates from the Creator in a way that the created entities can receive it. A [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) can be thought of as a basic building block of the structure called *partzuf*. Although *partzuf* literally means “countenance” or “face,” it is actually composed of a [head](/topics/head2), a [body](/topics/body3), and legs, similar to the structure of a human body. A *partzuf* is formed as a result of a [*fusion through collision*](/topics/fusion-through-collision), where the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) from the collision [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) the supernal light, forming a new structure that reflects the qualities and amounts of the supernal light [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) in the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1). In each of the five worlds in reality – [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2), [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1), and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2) – there are five *partzufim*, corresponding to the five primary [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot): [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1).

The ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) that are one below the other, which result from the ascent of the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) to the Creator, are called [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf) (as stated in *Histaklut Penimit* 8:13, section 1) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 3, Q & A 83).
The [will to receive](/topics/will-to-receive) in an emanated being is the “place” for all the [*shefa*](/topics/shefa1) and [light](/topics/light2) within it (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 1, Q & A 35).

The expression of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) and its [partition](/topics/partition2), when there is no [fusion](/topics/fusion-through-collision) in it and it is not raising [returning light](/topics/returning-light1), is called point. Just as a black point contains no whiteness, so too it has no [light](/topics/light2), on account of the [constriction](/topics/constriction) ([*tzimtzum*](/topics/tzimtzum1)) that rides upon it. It is also called “point” after the [constriction](/topics/constriction) ([*tzimtzum*](/topics/tzimtzum1)) that occurred in the middle point (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 3, Q & A 71).

The points refers mainly to the illumination of the [fusion](/topics/fusion-through-collision) that emerges due to the connection of the bottom *heh* to the first *heh*. These are called “points,” and there are three aspects here: First, when the bottom *heh* is in [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) of *nekudim* (points), such that the bottom *heh* is in the [eyes](/topics/eyes4) and the *yod*, (first) *heh*, and *vav* are in the ear nose and mouth. Then it is called the vowels *ḥolam*, which is above the letters *yod*, (first) *heh*, and *vav*, for the [light](/topics/light2) of the [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) does not give to the [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) from the bottom *heh*, but only from the first *heh*. Second, in the mystical meaning of the points under the letters *yod*, (first) *heh*, and *vav*, which are the vessels of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3). This is achieved through an upper [fusion](/topics/fusion-through-collision) of [*Ab*](/topics/ab) and [*Sag*](/topics/sag), which brings down the bottom *heh* from the [eyes](/topics/eyes4) to the mouth, in the mystical meaning of the *kamatz* vowel that is under the letters. Here too, the bottom *heh* is hidden away in the *kamatz*, which is an expression of [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), while the *yod*, (first) *heh*, and *vav* do not yet receive from the illumination of the bottom *heh*. Third, in the mystical meaning of the points that are within the letters *yod*, (first) *heh*, and *vav*. This is achieved through the illumination by the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2) of the *melafum* (the *shuruk* vowel): The [point](/topics/point) of the bottom *heh* is inside the *vav*, and this illumination enters within the letters *yod*, (first) *heh*, and *vav*, which are [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), and this engenders the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) of the points (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 6, Q & A 7). 
The four levels that emerge by means of a [fusion through collision](/topics/fusion-through-collision), at the time of the purity of the [partition](/topics/partition2), are called “points,” and their

It is known that [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) is entirely constructed from the [brains](/topics/brains2) of *Imma*. *Imma*, which is [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), divides into the [first three](/topics/first-three1) and the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones). Her [first three](/topics/first-three1) are [*Abba* and *Imma Ila’in*](/topics/abba-and-imma-ilain), which are [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim) that are covered and rebuffed from [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), while her [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) are [*Yisrael* *Sabba* and *Tevuna*](/topics/yisrael-sabba-and-tevuna1) and revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim) in the illumination of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1). Likewise, [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) that is constructed from *Imma* is in the mystical meaning of the verse: “And I am a smooth man” (Genesis 27:11). For from the [chest](/topics/chest) and above, the [first three](/topics/first-three1) of *Imma* illuminate in it, that is, the covered [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim), whereas from the [chest](/topics/chest) and below, the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) illuminate in it, which are revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). Since they are two virtually opposite expressions, the verse calls it “a smooth man,” smooth of hairs, as is known. 
Now, for the same reason the [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba) of [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) also divides into two. There is an upper [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba), from the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the [first three](/topics/first-three1) of *Imma*, which is covered [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). This is called [Leah](/topics/leah1). She [enclothes](/topics/enclothe) on its [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), and [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) until the [chest](/topics/chest), which is in the place of her covered [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). It also has a second [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba), from the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) of *Imma*, which is revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim), called Rachel. She [enclothes](/topics/enclothe) in the place of its [chest](/topics/chest) and below, that is, in the place of its revealed [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim). Accordingly, [Leah](/topics/leah1) receives only the [back side](/topics/back-side) of the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) ([Foundation](/topics/yesod1)) of *Imma*, which ends at the place of the [chest](/topics/chest). For she rebuffs [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) like the [first three](/topics/first-three1) of *Imma*, and cannot venture from the [chest](/topics/chest) and below, where the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Abba*](/topics/abba1) serves openly. The reverse is true of Rachel: Her entire holding is only in the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Abba*](/topics/abba1), in the mystical meaning of “father (*Abba*) founded (*yasad*) the daughter.” Consequently, she cannot suckle from above the [chest](/topics/chest) of [*Ze’er Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1), since there the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of [*Abba*](/topics/abba1) is hidden and concealed in the [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1) of *Imma* (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 14, Q & A 125).
The illumination of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) without [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim) is called .

The returning light is formed when the [partition](/topics/partition2) of a particular [level](/topics/level) of existence rebuffs the supernal light, returning it to its source in the manner of a light refracting off a mirror. This returning light is generated through the resistance of the receiving entity to receiving the supernal light. The returning light does not disappear but rather [enclothes](/topics/enclothe) the supernal light, which is then manifest as a new vessel for the supernal light. All the [levels](/topics/level) and [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf) of creation are formed through [enclothing](/topics/enclothe) supernal, or “direct light” in the receiving entity’s returning light.

This is the [light](/topics/light2) that is not received in the fourth level. That is, its special function is to fill the fourth level, which, however, does not receive the [light](/topics/light2), on account of the [partition](/topics/partition2) that blocks and rebuffs it. This action is called [fusion through collision](/topics/fusion-through-collision) (see *Histaklut Penimit*, v. 2, section 22, s.v., “*ve-hineh*”). Likewise, every receiving [vessel](/topics/vessel1) in the [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf), from the [constriction](/topics/constriction) ([*tzimtzum*](/topics/tzimtzum1)) and onwards, is drawn from this returning light, which serves for them in place of the fourth level in [*Ein Sof*](/topics/ein-sof1). 
V. 2, *Histaklut Penimit*, 79 (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 2).

There are two sides to the [light of giving](/topics/light-of-giving), right and left. The increase of [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim)
(“giving”) is called the right side, whereas the [constriction](/topics/constriction) ([*tzimtzum*](/topics/tzimtzum1)) of [*ḥassadim*](/topics/hassadim)
is called the left side. They are called “sides” to reflect their equal status, like two sides of the same level (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 4, section 17). 
A lower level can sometimes ascend to the same plane as a higher level, when that higher level requires it in order to complete itself. Then the lower level is considered the left, while the higher one is the right (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 1, Q & A 23).

This is the name for the second of the five [levels](/topics/level) (and corresponding light) of the soul: [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh), [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1), [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2), [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1), and [*yeḥida*](/topics/yehida1). These five [levels](/topics/level) of the soul correspond to the five primary *sefirot*, [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), as well as the five worlds, [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2), [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1), and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2). The *ruaḥ* [level](/topics/level) of the soul corresponds to and is the light of the [level](/topics/level) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) and the world of [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1). A person attains the illumination of this aspect of the soul after first attaining the illumination of the lowest part, which is the [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh).

*Ruaḥ* refers to the [light](/topics/light2) that is in the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of [*Ze*’*er* *Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1), or the world of [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1) ([Formation](/topics/yetzira1)).
For this reason, the [light of giving](/topics/light-of-giving) is called *ruaḥ* (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 1, Q & A 50) and the level of the [light](/topics/light2) of the *ruaḥ*, which is the [six extremities](/topics/six-extremities) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 13, Q & A 106).

*Adam Kadmon* is the first and innermost world, which precedes the four worlds of [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut) ([Emanation](/topics/atzilut)), [*Beria*](/topics/beria1) ([Creation](/topics/beria1)), [*Yetzira*](/topics/yetzira1) ([Formation](/topics/yetzira1)), and [*Asiya*](/topics/asiya2) ([Action](/topics/asiya2)). It incorporates all of existence, from its head, that is, the source, which is [*Ein Sof*](/topics/ein-sof1), to its lowest point, which is this physical world. This world is called *Adam Kadmon* because it is depicted in kabbalistic writings in the form of a man, having a head, body and appendages. Although all the worlds are likewise described in the form of a man, this world is the primeval one, before which there is no world, while the other worlds, which are external to it, are “mapped onto it,” lower manifestations of that primeval world: *Atzilut*, from the chest and below to the navel; and *Beria*, *Yetzira*, and *Asiya*, from the navel and below. This world corresponds to the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Keter*](/topics/keter1). Just as [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) itself is often regarded as above the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot), so too the world of *Adam Kadmon* is sometimes not considered part of the four worlds.

As is known, the name [*Havaya*](/topics/havaya2) is ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot), in which the *yod-heh* are [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), and the *vav-heh* are *Ze’ir* and [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba). However, it is not yet apparent which level these ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are from, whether on the level of [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh), [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1), or [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2) etc. This is established by writing out the letters in full – that is, when each letter of the name is spelled out as a word on its own. On the level of [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh), the letters are written with each *heh*, which leads to a numerical value of 52 (“*Ban*”; the numerical value of yod is 10, the value of vav is 6, the value of dalet is 4, and the value of heh is 5); on the level of [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1) they are written with each *alef*, giving a numerical value of 45 (“*Mah*”); on the level of [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2) they are written with each *yod* (except for the *vav*, which is filled out with an *alef*), leading to a numerical value of 63 (“*Sag*”); and finally, on the level of [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1) they are all written with each *yod*, including the *vav*, which provides a numerical value of 72 (“*Ab*”) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 13, Q & A 61).

*Sag* (or *samekh-gimmel*) of *Adam Kadmon* is the name of the third [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of the world of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2). This [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) is born from the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) of [*Ab* of *Adam Kadmon*](/topics/ab-partzuf) through the process of [fusion through collision](/topics/fusion-through-collision). It is also called “*partzuf* of *Bina* of *Adam Kadmon*,” because it is the embodiment of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) in the world of *Adam Kadmon*.  The name *Sag* stems from the Tetragrammaton, the four-letter name of God, as follows: In each [level](/topics/level) of reality, the name of God, also referred to as the name of *Havaya*, is revealed in a unique manner to that [level](/topics/level). This is expressed through the numerical value of the letters of the name, when it is written out in full, – that is, when each letter of the name is spelled out as a word on its own. The numerical value of the name of *Havaya* that is unique to the [level](/topics/level) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) is *samekh-gimmel*, or 63. This number results from filling out the letter *heh* with a *yod*, and the letter *vav* with an *alef*, as follows: *Yod* (*yod-vav-dalet*), *heh* (*heh-yod*), *vav* (*vav-alef-vav*), *heh* (*heh-yod*) (*yod*=10; *vav*=6; *dalet*=4; *heh*=5; *alef*=1).

The second constriction occurred in one of the formative stages of the [*partzufim*](/topics/partzuf) of [*Adam Kadmon*](/topics/adam-kadmon2) , in order to enable the creation of man and this world. The fourth [level](/topics/level), or phase of creation, which constitutes the will to receive, or the attribute of judgment, also known as the [level](/topics/level) of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), rose and mingled with the second [level](/topics/level), which constitutes the will to give, or the attribute of mercy, also known as the [level](/topics/level) of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), and thus the [partition](/topics/partition2) that is upon the [level](/topics/level) [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) rose to the second [level](/topics/level) as well. As a consequence of the [partition](/topics/partition2)’s new position, the light of the [levels](/topics/level) beneath the second [level](/topics/level), the third and fourth [levels](/topics/level), was darkened. It is this intermingling of the will to give with the will to receive that creates the capacity for free choice between these options for human beings.

The *sefirot* represent ten ways through which the Creator reveals Himself in the creation, with each *sefira* representing a different degree of revelation. The term *sefira* itself has the same root as the word sapir, which means sapphire or radiance, indicating that the divine light is contained within the *sefirot* and illuminates the creation through them.  Generally, there are ten *sefirot*: [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). But in essence there are five primary *sefirot*: [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). Additionally, each of these five *sefirot* are themselves composed of the other *sefirot*, since everything in reality is formed out of *sefirot*. Thus, for example, the *sefira* of [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) contains the [*levels*](/topics/level) of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1).  As for the five remaining *sefirot*, [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), they are encompassed within the *sefira* of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1). Like the other *sefirot*, the *sefira* of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) contains all five *sefirot*, but in this case they are called by different names: In this context, they are called [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah) and [*Hod*](/topics/hod1). The reason the sefirot are given different names is that a different kind of light from that of the other *sefirot*, called the “light of giving,” is revealed through [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1). Although they are named differently, they are still, in a sense, the same five *sefirot* mentioned above. Thus, [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed) is referred to as the [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura) as the [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) as the [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah) as the [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Hod*](/topics/hod1) as the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1). In addition to these five, there is another *sefira* that incorporates all the [*levels*](/topics/level) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) called [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1).

The ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of [direct light](/topics/direct-light1), which are [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) in the ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) of [returning light](/topics/returning-light1), emerging from the first [fusion through collision](/topics/fusion-through-collision), are called one *sefira*. They are named after the highest *sefira* in that level, despite the fact that it incorporates ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) lengthwise and ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) in its thickness (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 3, Q & A 74).

The *sefirot* represent ten ways through which the Creator reveals Himself in the creation, with each *sefira* representing a different degree of revelation. The term *sefira* itself has the same root as the word sapir, which means sapphire or radiance, indicating that the divine light is contained within the *sefirot* and illuminates the creation through them.  Generally, there are ten *sefirot*: [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). But in essence there are five primary *sefirot*: [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). Additionally, each of these five *sefirot* are themselves composed of the other *sefirot*, since everything in reality is formed out of *sefirot*. Thus, for example, the *sefira* of [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) contains the [levels](/topics/level) of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1).  As for the five remaining *sefirot*, [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), they are encompassed within the *sefira* of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1). Like the other *sefirot*, the *sefira* of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) contains all five *sefirot*, but in this case they are called by different names: In this context, they are called [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah) and [*Hod*](/topics/hod1). The reason the sefirot are given different names is that a different kind of light from that of the other *sefirot*, called the “light of giving,” is revealed through [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1). Although they are named differently, they are still, in a sense, the same five *sefirot* mentioned above. Thus, [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed) is referred to as the [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura) as the [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) as the [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah) as the [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Hod*](/topics/hod1) as the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1). In addition to these five, there is another *sefira* that incorporates all the [levels](/topics/level) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) called [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1).

The ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) that are drawn from the [partition](/topics/partition2) and below are called [body](/topics/body3) or the seven lower ones (see v. 2, Answers, answer 11). When on occasion, every [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) is regarded as only ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot), the [first three](/topics/first-three1) [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) will be [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), in the [head](/topics/head2) of the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1), while the seven lower ones, which are [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), are in the [body](/topics/body3) of the [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 25).

Often translated as bounty, flow, or abundance, *shefa* comes from the Hebrew word *hashpa’a*, which in this context means to give. Rays of sunlight, for example, can be described as the sun’s *shefa*. The rays constitute a “flow” of light from the sun that provides light and sustenance to the earth in bountiful abundance. In kabbalistic thought, *shefa*  refers to different forms of light that flow from God's essence or from the [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) and the like. Additionally, *shefa* can be used to refer both to God’s giving to creation, as well as the giving of created beings to each other.

“Height” refers to a characteristic of the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1), which reaches a certain height when it ascends as a result of the [*fusion through collision*](/topics/fusion-through-collision) of the supernal light against the [partition](/topics/partition2). What determines the height that the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) reaches is the intensity of the repulsion of the supernal light by the [partition](/topics/partition2) of the created entity.  The measurement of these dimensions of height is expressed in different ways. One way is by marking the highest [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of a given [level](/topics/level). An example would be a [level](/topics/level) that is the height of [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), or alternatively, a structure that is the height of the second [level](/topics/level) (another term for [*Bina*](/topics/bina3)).  Another way to express this idea is according to the amount of soul lights that have become contained within the particular [level](/topics/level), which are called [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh), [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1), [*neshama*](/topics/neshama2), [*ḥaya*](/topics/haya1), and [*yeḥida*](/topics/yehida1). For example, a “small height” is a [level](/topics/level) that contains only the light of [*nefesh*](/topics/nefesh). In comparison, a [level](/topics/level) that also contains the light of [*ruaḥ*](/topics/ruah1) is considered “taller.”  A third way of expressing this concept is according to the nature of the light itself that is contained within the particular [level](/topics/level). For example, a column with a “height of *hassadim*” indicates that the nature of the light in that context is the light of giving.

The six extremities refers to the six directional edges or limits of every physical being. They are: Above, below, right, left, front, and back. These six extremities are paralleled by the six [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) that represent the [body](/topics/body3) of a [*partzuf*](/topics/partzuf1): [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1). .

The lights that are typically extinguished, but which are ready to awaken, burn, and illuminate once again as before, are called sparks. This can occur only in the [returning light](/topics/returning-light1) (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 4, Q & A 46).

Although the supernal light wishes to permeate every [level](/topics/level) of reality, reality cannot fully contain it on account of its limited vessels, or receptacles. Therefore the supernal light that cannot be contained, called surrounding light, is always situated in the background and so has an indirect influence on reality. This contrasts with the [inner light](/topics/inner-light1), which is the supernal light that is currently [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) in reality and permeates it in accordance with the reality’s capacity to contain it. When reality is fully rectified in the future, the surrounding light too will be able to permeate it.

This is referring to the [light](/topics/light2) that is designed to [enclothe](/topics/enclothe) on a level, but which is blocked by some boundary within it. This name has two meanings: First, that it is a distant illumination; second, that it is a secure illumination, that is, it will ultimately be [enclothed](/topics/enclothe) there, for the [light](/topics/light2) “surrounds” it on all sides without leaving it any space from where it can escape, until it is ready to receive it fully (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 2, Q & A 4).

Talmud Eser HaSefirot is the Ba’al HaSulam’s masterwork. It presents an orderly and systematic collection from among the writings of the Arizal, in sixteen volumes, with a relatively short commentary called Or Penimi and a broad, comprehensive commentary called Histaklut Penimit. At the end of every volume there is a question-and-answer section that provides a clear summary of its concepts and ideas. Talmud Eser HaSefirot was published between 1933 and 1937.

The ten [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1). They are in essence only five: [*Keter*](/topics/keter1), [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), because the [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2) of [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) incorporates the six [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot): [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1). They become five *partzufin*: [*Arikh Anpin*](/topics/arikh-anpin1); [*Abba* and *Imma*](/topics/abba-and-imma); and [*Ze*’*er* *Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) and [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba). The [*Keter*](/topics/keter1) is called [*Arikh Anpin*](/topics/arikh-anpin1); [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1) and [*Bina*](/topics/bina3) are called [*Abba* and *Imma*](/topics/abba-and-imma); and finally, [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1) and [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) are called [*Ze*’*er* *Anpin*](/topics/zeer-anpin1) and [*Nukba*](/topics/nukba) (*Zohar*, *Ma’amar HaShoshana*, 3).

When the [partition](/topics/partition2) that is above the [level](/topics/level) of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) prevent the supernal light, or direct light, entering it, yet a [fusion through collision](/topics/fusion-through-collision) does not occur there, this [level](/topics/level) of [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) is known as the terminating *Malkhut*. It is a terminating [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) because it constitutes the end of the [level](/topics/level).

In the [chest](/topics/chest) of *Imma* there remains a trace of the immaturity of the bottom *heh* in the [eyes](/topics/eyes4), even upon her [maturity](/topics/maturity2), after the *heh* has descended from there. Now, this trace causes the *parsa* (separation) within the intestine of *Imma*, dividing between the [body](/topics/body3) and [eyes](/topics/eyes4), which are now her [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), *Daat*, [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), and [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), and the ear nose and mouth, which are her [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), from the [chest](/topics/chest) and below. Accordingly, the [first three](/topics/first-three1) are expressed only from the [chest](/topics/chest)> and above, that is, her first six *sefirot*: [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), *Daat*, [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura), and [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), which are above the trace of the bottom *heh*. By contrast, the four [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot): [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), which are below her [chest](/topics/chest)>, no longer contain the first three, since they are from the [chest](/topics/chest) and below, where the trace of the bottom *heh* remains. With respect to this name, the upper six [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot) are called “circular *samekh*,” while the lower four, [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), are called the final, or “closed *mem*.” All this applies to the upper *Imma*. From the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the upper *Imma*, that is, the trace of the bottom *heh* in the place of the [chest](/topics/chest), [*Yisrael* *Sabba* and *Tevuna*](/topics/yisrael-sabba-and-tevuna1) emerge. This [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) is called *dalet* (“four”), because it incorporates the four [*sefirot*](/topics/sefirot): [*Tiferet*](/topics/tiferet1), [*Netzaḥ*](/topics/netzah), [*Hod*](/topics/hod1), and [*Yesod*](/topics/yesod1), which are the final *mem*. Thus, [*Yisrael* *Sabba* and *Tevuna*](/topics/yisrael-sabba-and-tevuna1) is the fourth level of the upper *Imma*, such that the *samekh* and final *mem* are in the upper *Imma*, while *dalet* is in [*Yisrael* *Sabba* and *Tevuna*](/topics/yisrael-sabba-and-tevuna1). These letters: *Samekh*, final *mem*, and *dalet*, are also considered three *Tevunot*, since they are three separate levels. For the *samekh*, which is entirely above the bottom *heh*, is an expression of the [first three](/topics/first-three1), while the final *mem* is an expression of the [six extremities](/topics/six-extremities) without a [head](/topics/head2), where they are 120 combinations of *Elohim*, that is, thirty combinations in each [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2). The *dalet*, which is an expression of [*Yisrael* *Sabba* and *Tevuna*](/topics/yisrael-sabba-and-tevuna1), is even lower than the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the upper *Imma* itself, which is called a final *mem*. For [*Yisrael* *Sabba* and *Tevuna*](/topics/yisrael-sabba-and-tevuna1) does not emerge from the [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1) of the *Imma* itself, but from the externality of that [*Malkhut*](/topics/malkhut1), as stated in Answer 3, above. Therefore, it is far lower than the final *mem* of the upper *Imma*. In it, all of the [seven lower ones](/topics/seven-lower-ones) are in the mystical meaning of names of *Elohim*, except for its [*Ḥesed*](/topics/hesed), that is, from [*Gevura*](/topics/gevura) and below, which are twenty-four combinations in each [*sefira*](/topics/sefira2). Accordingly, the *samekh*, final *mem*, and *dalet* are considered three *Tevunot*, or three levels in [*Bina*](/topics/bina3), which are very much distanced from one another (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 10, Q & A 65).

The name *Mah* is [*Havaya*](/topics/havaya2) when the letters of the name are written as follows: *yod* (*yod-vav-dalet*), *heh* (*heh-alef*)*, vav* (*vav-alef-vav*), *heh (heh-alef*). All of the levels that emerged in [*Atzilut*](/topics/atzilut) ([Emanation](/topics/atzilut)) are expressions of [*Havaya*](/topics/havaya2) of *Mah* (*Talmud Eser Sefirot*, v. 8, Q & A 30).

The [light](/topics/light2) initially spreads and emerges from the Creator as [light of *Ḥokhma*](/topics/light-of-hokhma), which is the entirety of its life force belonging to that emanated being. It incorporates the first [level](/topics/level) of the [will to receive](/topics/will-to-receive) and is called the first expansion, or the first [level](/topics/level). Subsequently, a will of giving prevails in that [light](/topics/light2). The prevailing of this will draws out [light](/topics/light2) of *ĥassadim* from the Creator, and this is called the first prevailment, or the second [level](/topics/level). Next, that [light](/topics/light2) of *ĥassadim* expands with a great expansion, that is, with the illumination of [*Ḥokhma*](/topics/hokhma1), which is called the second expansion, or the third [level](/topics/level).
